Body:
I want to access private calendar content in read-only, from an IoT device.

This device is programmed in C, and has full REST capabilities meaning that I am able to build HTTP requests in the device, but I don't have any way of interracting with it (no screen, no keyboard).

I found a way to do this (using google data api), but it is completely deprecated.

What is the procedure to follow for doing this?

By checking the GData API Directory, it says here that Calendar is now replaced by [Google Calendar API](https://developers.google.com/google-apps/calendar/concepts/#basic_concepts). You can also see here, on how to [authorize request with Oath 2.0](https://developers.google.com/google-apps/calendar/auth). Check also this [tutorial](https://blog.tsheets.com/2014/business-help/using-oauth-2-0-to-authenticate-with-rest-ful-web-apis) for more information and if it can help you.

Thanks for the response.	I read the tutorial, but I doubt it is applicable to my case.	I need a kind of server-to-server authentication scheme, but without interaction from the user, as it is a device which access google calendar api.
